paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant p.(Ala614Val) associated with Long QT Syndrome type 2, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQT2, prolonged QTc interval (528 msec), syncope episodes.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A genomic test was performed... A pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene p.(Ala614Val) was detected, which along with abnormal electrocardiogram confirm the diagnosis of LQT2 syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The p.(Ala614Val) variant is known to have a dominant negative effect on the potassium channel function.

variants.segregation_data: Not evaluated due to lack of family genomic data.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and variant classification.
variants.additional_notes: The patient exhibited resistance to beta-blocker treatment, indicating a high-risk profile.
key_quotes: The genomic test detected a missense variant c.1841C>T; p. (Ala614Val) in the KCNH2 gene, which was a known pathogenic variant associated with LQT2.
The high SCD risk observed in this proband allows the ICD implantation as the best treatment option based on genomic results and lack of treatment response.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted successfully.
